clinical_study.brief_title: ClosureFAST vs. Laser Ablation for the Treatment of GSV Disease: A Multicenter, Single-Blinded, Randomized Study.
clinical_study.official_title: Radiofrequency Endovenous ClosureFAST vs. Laser Ablation for the Treatment of Great Saphenous Reflux: A Multicenter, Single-Blinded, Randomized Study (RECOVERY)

lead_sponsor.agency: VNUS Medical Technologies, A Covidien Company

clinical_study.source: VNUS Medical Technologies, A Covidien Company

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this post-market study is to compare the post-procedure recovery between two types of minimally invasive catheter treatments for venous disease in the Great Saphenous Vein.

detailed_description.textblock: Comparison of the post-procedure recovery of radiofrequency treatment vs. laser treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-procedure recovery for each treatment group; including post-procedure pain and return to normal activities.

arm_group.description: Treatment of venous disease with a Radiofrequency catheter.
Treatment of venous disease with an Endovenous Laser catheter.

intervention.intervention_name: Segmental RF ablation with the ClosureFAST catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All subjects must provide written informed consent.
- Must be a candidate for either treatment with RFA or endovenous laser.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who require additional treatments in either leg within 30 days before or after the study procedure.
- Subjects who are participating in another investigational study.
